finalProject

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalProject.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    The navigator is used to change either the robot's position or heading in a controlled manner. The navigator intakes values from the odometer continuously and takes a value for either angle or position from another class and computes the difference in heading before using the difference in wheel angle count of the robot to find the amount of change needed to have the correct heading. Once the robot has the correct heading, if the robot needs to move to another position the robot calculates the amount of distance it needs to travel to reach the correct position before going there and stopping.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Ian Gauthier, Ilana Haddad, Tristan Bouchard, Tyrone Wong, Alexandre Tessier

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y)
        The method moves the robot to the position that is inputed into the method by first travelling to (x,0) and then to (x,y), breaking it up into two steps. Therefore, this method travels in straight lines rather than diagonally to final coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate that should be moved to
        y - the X coordinate that should be moved to

      • travelToDiag

        public void travelToDiag(double x,
                double y)
        This method will travel to the coordinates x and y diagonally rather than split into x and y. This should call the turnTo method to turn to the correct heading of the robot before finding the distance and moving that distance in a straight heading.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate that should be moved to
        y - the X coordinate that should be moved to

      • drive

        public void drive(double delta_x,
         double delta_y)
        The method should convert the distance into an angle in terms of the radius of the wheel and then travel forward that amount. Insert x and y coordinates and the EV3 travels on the x,y planes to reach the destination
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance to be converted in terms of cm

      • driveDiag

        public void driveDiag(double travelDist)
        This method travels to distance inputed diagonally.
        Parameters:
        travelDist -

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        The method should intake an angle and then turn the robot to that angle.
        Parameters:
        theta - the angle which should be turned to

      • turnToSmart

        public void turnToSmart(double angle)
        The method causes the robot to turn to an angle in relation to its current heading meaning that if 150 is input, the robot should turn 150 degrees
        Parameters:
        angle - the amount to be turned

      • getDest

        public double[] getDest()

      • isTurning

        public boolean isTurning()
        Returns:
        a boolean that is true if the robot it turning and false if it not

      • stopNav

        public void stopNav()
        This method should return an exception when the robot's navigation has been interrupted to alert the system of the interruption.
